issue.title: [CF 1193] TMW icon to display the status of an interface setting
issue.body:
Hello,

Is there a way to define a TMW icon to display the status of an interface setting?

For example, there is a setting called Click-to-Move located here:

        Interface > Mouse > Click-to-Move

...which, when selected, makes it so that your character will run (or fly) to wherever you click and which I have found to be extremely helpful (due to paralysis in my fingers from quadriplegia) -- but only if I can easily toggle it on and off.

I found a macro* which does just that (toggles the setting on & off) but now the problem is that I don't always know/remember which position it's in.

This seems like yet another perfect situation for employing a TMW icon -- configured to show when the setting is on (or off) but I have not been able to figure out how to do it.

Many thanks

*/click InterfaceOptionsMousePanelClickToMove 1


> Posted by CurseForge user WeThotUWasAToad | Imported from CurseForge issue #1193 | Raw

comments.body:
You can add the following as a Lua condition to a Condition icon:

``` GetCVar("autointeract") == "1" ```

Here's an export string:

^1^T^SType^Sconditionicon ^SConditions^T ^N1^T ^SType^SLUA ^SName^SGetCVar("autointeract")~`==~`"1" ^t^Sn^N1 ^t^SCustomTex^S89570 ^SShowWhen^N3 ^SUnAlpha^N0.3 ^SEnabled^B ^t^N70000^S~`~| ^Sicon^^


> Posted by CurseForge user Cybeloras

You could also add the following to a Lua notification handler with the On Click trigger if you want to built the toggling into the status display:

``` InterfaceOptionsMousePanelClickToMove:Click() ```

> Posted by CurseForge user Cybeloras
